关于 NLP，Terry Winograd 的麻省理工学院论文（1972 年在认知心理学中以“理解自然语言”的形式发表）是 NLP 早期历史上的一个里程碑，尽管其他一些重要的工作已经在进行中，例如“Transition Network Grammars用于自然语言分析”，威廉·伍兹 (William Woods)。（罗伯特西蒙斯在 1965 年的文章“用计算机回答英语问题”中调查了一些问答系统。）丹尼尔朱拉夫斯基和詹姆斯马丁写了一本关于 NLP，语音和语言处理的最新教科书, 持续更新。关于语音识别和语音理解，Mark Liberman 和 Charles Wayne 在“人类语言技术”中进行了全面回顾。最近对 Winograd 模式的关注源于 HJL、Ernest Davis 和 Leora Morgenstern 于 2012 年发表的论文“Winograd 模式挑战”，并在 HJL 的Common Sense一书中进一步讨论。（要从中吸取教训，请参阅下面第 11 章的注释。）

In regard to NLP, Terry Winograd’s MIT thesis (published as “Understanding Natural Language” in Cognitive Psychology in 1972) was a milestone in the early history of NLP, although a number of other important efforts were already underway, such as “Transition Network Grammars for Natural Language Analysis” by William Woods. (Robert Simmons surveyed a number of question-answering systems in 1965 in his article “Answering English Questions by Computer.”) Daniel Jurafsky and James Martin wrote a more recent textbook on NLP, Speech and Language Processing, with ongoing updates. On speech recognition and speech understanding, Mark Liberman and Charles Wayne provide a thorough review in “Human Language Technology.” The recent attention to Winograd schemas arose out of a 2012 paper by HJL, Ernest Davis, and Leora Morgenstern, “The Winograd Schema Challenge,” and were further discussed in HJL’s Common Sense book. (For a lesson to learn from them, see the notes below on chapter 11.)

基于规则的系统出现的早期先兆是明斯基主编的《语义信息处理》 ；它以使用符号知识支持人工智能的几位先驱的博士论文为特色。在 Frederick Hayes-Roth、Donald Waterman 和 Douglas Lenat 合着的《构建专家系统》一书中以及Peter Jackson 合着的《专家系统导论》中全面详细地描述了专家系统。MYCIN 系统在爱德华·肖特利夫 (Edward Shortliffe) 的《基于计算机的医学咨询》一书中有介绍. MYCIN 在传染性脑膜炎治疗建议方面的能力在 1984 年 Victor Yu 及其同事在“对 MYCIN 的建议的评估”中报告的正式评估中进行了检查。在盲法、两阶段评估中，其建议被评为可接受的频率高于那些七名医生和一名医学生。Prospector 的详细信息由其发明者 Richard Duda、John Gaschnig 和 Peter Hart 发表在“用于矿产勘探的 Prospector 顾问系统中的模型设计”中，其发明者 John McDermott 在“R1: ARule-Based Configurer of Computer Systems”（原名 R1）以及后来由 Judith Bachant 和 Elliot Soloway 撰写的评论“XCON 工程”。梅兰妮·米切尔 (Melanie Mitchell) 关于专家系统的脆弱性的引述出自她的《人工智能》一书第 39-40 页。

An early harbinger of the emergence of rule-based systems is Semantic Information Processing, edited by Minsky; it features the doctoral theses of several pioneers in the use of symbolic knowledge to support AI. Expert systems are described in comprehensive detail in the book Building Expert Systems by Frederick Hayes-Roth, Donald Waterman, and Douglas Lenat as well as Introduction to Expert Systems by Peter Jackson. The MYCIN system is presented in Edward Shortliffe’s book Computer-Based Medical Consultations. MYCIN’s competency in therapy recommendation for infectious meningitis was examined in a formal evaluation reported in “An Evaluation of MYCIN’s Advice” by Victor Yu and colleagues in 1984. In a blinded, two-phase evaluation, its recommendations were rated as acceptable more often than those of seven physicians and a medical student. Details on Prospector were published by its inventors, Richard Duda, John Gaschnig, and Peter Hart, in “Model Design in the Prospector Consultant System for Mineral Exploration,” and on XCON by its inventor, John McDermott, in “R1: A Rule-Based Configurer of Computer Systems” (under its original name, R1) as well as in the later review “The Engineering of XCON” by Judith Bachant and Elliot Soloway. The quote from Melanie Mitchell about the brittleness of expert systems is from pages 39–40 of her book Artificial Intelligence.

关于集成系统，人工智能以机器人 Shakey 的形式首次在 1970 年由 Brad Darrach 发表在《生活》杂志的一篇长篇文章中向公众展示。Shakey 在文章的标题“认识 Shaky [原文如此]，第一个电子人”中得到了挑衅性的描述，该标题还声称 Shakey 有“自己的想法”。大约三十年后，Wolfram Burgard 及其同事在“交互式博物馆导游机器人的体验”中展示了博物馆导游机器人。Sebastian Thrun 和他的团队在“Stanley：赢得 DARPA 大挑战赛的机器人”中详细记录了赢得 2005 年 DARPA 大挑战赛的无人驾驶汽车。深空一号上的人工智能系统Nicola Muscettola 及其同事在“Remote Agent”中对此进行了讨论。RoboCup 比赛在 Minoru Asada 及其公司 1999 年的文章“RoboCup”中有所描述，最近由 Asada 和 Oskar von Stryk 在“RoboCup 中的科学和技术挑战”中进行了描述。Soar 架构在 John Laird 2019 年出版的《The Soar Cognitive Architecture》一书中有所介绍。RJB、David Gunning 和 Murray Burke在最近的AI 杂志文章“集成 AI 系统”中调查了其他机器人和非机器人集成 AI 系统。有关侧重于更多认知方面的机器人研究的回顾，请参阅 HJL 和 Gerhard Lakemeyer 的文章“认知机器人”。

Regarding integrated systems, AI, in the form of Shakey the robot, was first presented to the general public in a lengthy 1970 Life Magazine article by Brad Darrach. Shakey was given a provocative description in the article’s title, “Meet Shaky [sic], the First Electronic Person,” which also claimed that Shakey had “a mind of its own.” The museum-guide robot was presented some thirty years later by Wolfram Burgard and colleagues in “Experiences with an Interactive Museum Tour-Guide Robot.” The car that won the 2005 DARPA Grand Challenge for driving without human intervention is documented in detail by Sebastian Thrun and his team in “Stanley: The Robot That Won the DARPA Grand Challenge.” The AI system aboard Deep Space 1 is discussed by Nicola Muscettola and colleagues in “Remote Agent.” The RoboCup competitions are described in the 1999 article “RoboCup” by Minoru Asada and company, and more recently by Asada and Oskar von Stryk in “Scientific and Technological Challenges in RoboCup.” The Soar architecture is presented in John Laird’s 2019 book, The Soar Cognitive Architecture. Other robotic and nonrobotic integrated AI systems are surveyed in the recent AI Magazine article “Integrated AI Systems” by RJB, David Gunning, and Murray Burke. For a review of robotics research that concentrates on the more cognitive aspects, see the article “Cognitive Robotics” by HJL and Gerhard Lakemeyer.

说到机器人，有关 AI 最先进技术的新闻报道或纪录片总是展示看起来像人或以类人方式移动的机器人。在大多数情况下，这些人形机器人与人工智能关系不大。重点更多地放在他们的外表上，而不是他们能做什么。它们甚至可能由躲在场边的人类远程操作——这一传统可以追溯到 1770 年代的国际象棋机器人（其中一个著名的机器人被称为土耳其机器人）。

Speaking of robots, news reports or documentaries about the state of the art in AI invariably show robots that look human or move in a humanlike way. For the most part, these humanoid robots have little to do with AI. The emphasis is much more on the way they look than on what they can do. They might even be teleoperated by humans hiding on the sidelines—a tradition going back to the chess-playing automatons of the 1770s (a well-known one of which was called the Mechanical Turk).

现在转向数据驱动学习，最初只是在神经网络建模方面做出的小努力，现已发展成为当今 AI 的主导力量。学习深度学习的好去处是近期图灵奖获得者 Yann LeCun、Yoshua Bengio 和 Geoffrey Hinton在Nature发表的权威文章《深度学习》。一项更广泛的调查，包含 300 多篇参考文献（包括提到的一些早期工作此处），“深度学习理论和架构的最先进调查”，由 Md Zahangir Alom 及其同事撰写。微软、IBM、谷歌等很多地方的应用也在本文中讨论。米切尔的人工智能第 180 页报道了杰夫·迪恩关于深度学习对语音工作的影响的引述。Christopher Shallue 和 Andrew Vanderburg 在“使用深度学习识别系外行星”中讨论了深度学习在天文学中的应用。纽约时报发表了 Farhad Manjoo 关于 GPT-3 的专栏文章，“你怎么知道这是人写的？”发表于 2020 年 7 月 29 日。GPT-2 变压器输出的希腊例子取自 Marcus 的挑衅性“The人工智能的下一个十年”预印本。（我们的生日蛋糕示例是使用相同的程序生成的。）基于深度学习的围棋游戏方法在 David Silver 的多作者文章“使用深度神经网络和树搜索掌握围棋游戏”中进行了描述。François Chollet 关于深度学习局限性的引述来自他 2019 年的预印本“关于智力的衡量”，尽管其他研究人员也表达了类似的疑虑。此处引用第一行的“下一部小说”是《日内瓦别了》由约翰·莱维斯克 (John Levesque) 着。可以在http://www.natcorp.ox.ac.uk/在线找到有关英国国家语料库的信息。欧内斯特·戴维斯 (Ernest Davis) 对这个语料库中存在大量稀有词的观察，在 HJL 的常识书第 7 章中讨论了像这样的长尾分布对常识的影响。

Turning now to data-driven learning, what started out as a small effort in neural network modeling has grown to become the dominant force in AI today. A good place to learn about deep learning is the authoritative article “Deep Learning” in Nature by the recent Turing Award winners Yann LeCun, Yoshua Bengio, and Geoffrey Hinton. A more extensive survey with over three hundred references (including to some of the earlier work mentioned here), “A State-of-the-Art Survey on Deep Learning Theory and Architectures,” was written by Md Zahangir Alom and colleagues. Many of the applications at Microsoft, IBM, Google, and other places are also discussed in this paper. The quote from Jeff Dean about the impact of deep learning on speech work is reported on page 180 of Mitchell’s Artificial Intelligence. Christopher Shallue and Andrew Vanderburg discuss the use of deep learning in astronomy in “Identifying Exoplanets with Deep Learning.” The New York Times ran an op-ed piece by Farhad Manjoo about GPT-3, “How Do You Know a Human Wrote This?,” appearing on July 29, 2020. The Greek example of the GPT-2 transformer output was taken from Marcus’s provocative “The Next Decade in AI” preprint. (Our birthday cake example was generated using the same program.) The methods based on deep learning for playing the game of Go are described in David Silver’s multiauthor article “Mastering the Game of Go with Deep Neural Networks and Tree Search” in Nature. The quote from François Chollet on the limitations of deep learning is from his 2019 preprint “On the Measure of Intelligence,” although other researchers have expressed similar misgivings. The “very next novel” whose first line is quoted here is Geneva Farewell by John Levesque. Information on the British National Corpus can be found online at http://www.natcorp.ox.ac.uk/. The observation concerning the large presence of rare words in this corpus is due to Ernest Davis, and the implication for common sense of long-tail distributions like this is discussed in chapter 7 of HJL’s Common Sense book.

第 4 章：知识及其表示

Chapter 4: Knowledge and Its Representation

本章是关于常识研究的一些基础，这些常识涉及知识、表示和推理，以及它们与逻辑的联系。

This chapter is about some of the underpinnings of the study of common sense regarding knowledge, representation, and reasoning, and their connection to logic.

自古希腊时代以来，知识主题一直是哲学研究的支柱。该领域的两本论文集是A. Phillips Griffiths 的Knowledge and Belief和 Michael Roth 和 Leon Galis 的Knowing。哲学家 Jaakko Hintikka在《知识与信念》一书中介绍了一种开创性的知识数学分析——这项工作已在计算机科学中得到进一步应用，如Ronald Fagin 及其同事在《关于知识的推理》一书中所见。强调其符号表示的知识研究知识库的逻辑可以在HJL 和 Gerhard Lakemeyer 合着的The Logic of Knowledge Bases一书中找到。

The topic of knowledge has been a mainstay of philosophical study since the time of the ancient Greeks. Two collections of papers in this area are Knowledge and Belief by A. Phillips Griffiths and Knowing by Michael Roth and Leon Galis. A groundbreaking mathematical analysis of knowledge was introduced in the book Knowledge and Belief by philosopher Jaakko Hintikka—work that has found further application in computer science, as seen in the book Reasoning about Knowledge by Ronald Fagin and colleagues. A study of knowledge that emphasizes its symbolic representation in knowledge bases can be found in the book The Logic of Knowledge Bases by HJL and Gerhard Lakemeyer.

逻辑本身是一门庞大的学科，包含许多不同的想法，甚至难以概括。出于我们的目的，我们可以将注意力限制在经典西方传统中的演绎逻辑，如 Alex Malpass 和 Marianna Antonutti Marfori 合集《哲学和形式逻辑史》. 如文中所述，符号逻辑的现代形式归功于 Gottlob Frege，具体符号归功于 1900 年代初期的数学家 Giuseppe Peano。关键的发展是一个正式的系统，它不仅包括句子级的运算符，如“and”、“or”和“not”（所谓的布尔运算符，来自早期的逻辑学家 George Boole），而且还包括第一个时间、带参数的谓词、变量和量词，所有这些我们都将在第 8 章中使用并进一步讨论。

Logic itself is a massive subject, incorporating a number of disparate ideas, difficult to even summarize. For our purposes, we can restrict our attention to deductive logic in the classical Western tradition, as in the Alex Malpass and Marianna Antonutti Marfori collection The History of Philosophical and Formal Logic. As noted in the text, the modern form of symbolic logic is due to Gottlob Frege, with a specific notation due to mathematician Giuseppe Peano, in the early 1900s. The key development was that of a formal system that included not only sentence-level operators like “and,” “or,” and “not” (the so-called Boolean operators, from the earlier logician George Boole) but also for the first time, predicates with arguments, variables, and quantifiers, all of which we will be making use of and further discussing in chapter 8.

大卫·奥尔森 (David Olson) 的《纸上思维》 (The Mind on Paper)一书中阐述了文字等符号对人类思维过程的重要性，尤其是通过阅读和写作。戈特弗里德·莱布尼茨 (Gottfried Leibniz) 是有史以来最迷人的思想家之一，他是文字和数字等表征工作的早期发起人。莱布尼茨的名言摘自他 1677 年为《普通科学》写的序言，在尼古拉斯·乔利 (Nicholas Jolley) 的The Cambridge Companion to Leibniz合集中重印。它清楚地引用了我们现在所说的符号处理，但这个想法的实际特征（与算术不同）直到近三百年后才出现在约翰·麦卡锡、艾伦·纽厄尔和其他人的著作中。（例如，参见麦卡锡 1960 年的论文“符号表达式的递归函数及其机器计算，第一部分”。）甚至逻辑学家库尔特·哥德尔在 1930 年代涉及逻辑语言公式处理的工作也是根据通过首先将这些公式映射到数字（后来被称为哥德尔化）来进行算术运算。

The importance of symbols like words to the process of thinking in humans, especially through reading and writing, is addressed in the book The Mind on Paper by David Olson. An early originator in the work on representations such as words and numerals is Gottfried Leibniz, one of the most fascinating thinkers of all time. The Leibniz quote is from his 1677 Preface to the General Science, reprinted in the collection The Cambridge Companion to Leibniz by Nicholas Jolley. It has a clear reference to what we would now call symbol processing, but the actual characterization of that idea (as distinct from arithmetic) only came almost three hundred years later in the work of John McCarthy, Allen Newell, and others. (See McCarthy’s 1960 paper, “Recursive Functions of Symbolic Expressions and Their Computation by Machine, Part I,” for example.) Even the work of logician Kurt Gödel in the 1930s involving the processing of formulas of a logical language was cast in terms of arithmetic by first mapping these formulas onto numbers (in what has come to be called Gödelization).

麦卡锡关于常识的引述摘自他 1958 年的论文“具有常识的程序”，该论文在第 1 章开头提到。知识表示假设引自布赖恩·坎特威尔·史密斯的博士论文“过程语言中的反射和语义”。这个想法通常归功于麦卡锡，但其他 AI 研究人员显然也在同一条轨道上。对于 Allen Newell 和 Herb Simon，重点更多地放在符号方面，他们的版本被称为物理符号系统假设，他们在 1976 年的论文中以这种方式描述了这一假设“Computer Science as Empirical Inquiry”：“物理符号系统具有一般智能行为的必要和充分手段。”

The McCarthy quote on common sense was taken from his 1958 paper, “Programs with Common Sense,” noted at the start of chapter 1. The knowledge representation hypothesis is quoted from Brian Cantwell Smith’s PhD thesis “Reflection and Semantics in a Procedural Language.” Credit for the idea is usually given to McCarthy, but other AI researchers were clearly on the same track. For Allen Newell and Herb Simon, the emphasis was more on the symbolic aspects, and their version is called the physical symbol system hypothesis, which they characterized this way in their 1976 paper “Computer Science as Empirical Inquiry”: “A physical symbol system has the necessary and sufficient means for general intelligent action.”

麦卡锡关于基于知识的系统的认识论和启发式充分性的观点在他 1977 年发表的“人工智能的认识论问题”一文中进行了讨论。

McCarthy’s ideas on the epistemological and heuristic adequacy of knowledge-based systems are discussed in his 1977 “Epistemological Problems of Artificial Intelligence” article.

本章提到了几位主要领导人，他们追随麦卡锡的道路，使用逻辑公式来表示常识性知识。例如，参见欧内斯特·戴维斯 (Ernest Davis) 1990 年出版的《常识知识表征》( Representations of Commonsense Knowledge)、约瑟夫·哈尔彭 (Joseph Halpern) 2017 年出版的《关于不确定性的推理》(Reasoning about Uncertainty)一书、杰瑞·霍布斯 (Jerry Hobbs) 和罗伯特·摩尔 (Robert Moore) 1985 年出版的《常识世界的形式理论》(Formal Theories of the Commonsense World)以及 2001 年出版的《知识在行动》(Knowledge in Action)一书雷蒙·赖特。关于考虑扩展逻辑以合并默认值和典型性等概念的需要，请参阅非单调推理中的阅读资料集马修·金斯伯格着。明斯基关于逻辑推理不足的引述出现在他 1985 年论文“表示知识的框架”的第 262 页。（本文在第 6 章中进行了更详细的讨论，Roger Schank 和学生们的工作也是如此。）

The chapter mentions several key leaders who followed McCarthy’s path in using logical formulas to represent commonsense knowledge. See, for example, the 1990 book Representations of Commonsense Knowledge by Ernest Davis, the 2017 book Reasoning about Uncertainty by Joseph Halpern, the 1985 book Formal Theories of the Commonsense World by Jerry Hobbs and Robert Moore, and the 2001 book Knowledge in Action by Raymond Reiter. On the need to consider extensions to logic to incorporate notions like defaults and typicality, see the collection Readings in Nonmonotonic Reasoning by Matthew Ginsberg. The Minsky quote about the inadequacy of logical reasoning is on page 262 of his 1985 paper, “A Framework for Representing Knowledge.” (This paper is discussed at greater length in chapter 6, as is the work of Roger Schank and students.)

虽然 Cyc 可能是 AI 中连续运行时间最长的项目，但它也是最具争议的项目之一——与其说是因为它雄心勃勃的使命，不如说是因为它极度缺乏信息流。Cyc 上有经过同行评审的出版物，例如 Cynthia Matuszek 及其同事的“Searching for Common Sense”和 Michael Witbrock 及其同事的“An Interactive Dialogue System for Knowledge Acquisition in Cyc”，但鉴于 35年的这种规模的研究项目。也许最全面的说明是《构建大型知识型系统》一书由 Douglas Lenat 和 Ramanathan Guha 撰写，但这被认为是一份“中期报告”，并不能反映 1989 年之后的工作。许多关于 Cyc 的说法只出现在流行杂志上，例如 2019 年 7 月网络版上提到的 Lenat 的文章福布斯的题为“AI 可以从罗密欧与朱丽叶中学到什么”的文章。（Lenat 关于“启发式推理模块”的引述来自那篇文章。）关于该项目的几乎所有信息都受到项目和公司领导者的小心控制。例如，关于 Cyc 实际大小的报价来自 Cyc 网站，据我们所知尚未得到独立确认。Ernest Davis 和 Gary Marcus 在他们的 ACM 通讯中评论了这种有点不幸的情况《人工智能中的常识推理与常识知识》一文如下：

While probably the longest continuously running project in AI, Cyc has also been one of the most controversial—less because of its ambitious mission than because of the extreme lack of information flow about it. There have been peer-reviewed publications on Cyc, such as “Searching for Common Sense” by Cynthia Matuszek and colleagues and “An Interactive Dialogue System for Knowledge Acquisition in Cyc” by Michael Witbrock and colleagues, but they are rare given a thirty-five-year research project of this magnitude. Perhaps the most comprehensive account is the book Building Large Knowledge-Based Systems by Douglas Lenat and Ramanathan Guha, but this was deemed a “midterm report” and does not reflect the work after 1989. Many of the claims about Cyc appear only in popular magazines, such as the mentioned piece by Lenat from the July 2019 online issue of Forbes entitled “What AI Can Learn From Romeo & Juliet.” (The quote by Lenat on “heuristic reasoning modules” is taken from that article.) Almost all information about the project has been carefully controlled by project and company leaders. For example, the quote on the actual size of Cyc is from the Cyc website and has not to our knowledge been independently confirmed. Ernest Davis and Gary Marcus comment on this somewhat unfortunate situation in their Communications of the ACM article “Commonsense Reasoning and Commonsense Knowledge in Artificial Intelligence” as follows:

如果系统地描述和评估 CYC，该领域可能会受益匪浅。如果 CYC 已经解决了一些重要的常识性推理问题，那么知道这一点很重要，既可以作为有用的工具，也可以作为进一步研究的起点。如果 CYC 遇到困难，从错误中吸取教训将很有用。如果 CYC 完全没有用，那么研究人员至少可以不用担心他们是否在重新发明轮子。

The field might well benefit if CYC were systematically described and evaluated. If CYC has solved some significant fraction of commonsense reasoning, then it is critical to know that, both as a useful tool, and as a starting point for further research. If CYC has run into difficulties, it would be useful to learn from the mistakes that were made. If CYC is entirely useless, then researchers can at least stop worrying about whether they are reinventing the wheel.

汤姆·米切尔 (Tom Mitchell) 及其团队在 2018 年的一篇文章“永无止境的学习”中描述了 NELL 项目。GOFAI 术语来自 John Haugeland 的著作《人工智能：真正的想法》。

The NELL project is described in a 2018 article “Never-Ending Learning” by Tom Mitchell and his team. The GOFAI term is from John Haugeland’s book Artificial Intelligence: The Very Idea.

Yann LeCun、Yoshua Bengio 和 Geoffrey Hinton 等深度学习社区的思想领袖强调了本书主题的重要性，他们提到了他们认为常识对于 AI 系统的重要性。也许并不奇怪，他们相信某种形式的深度学习最终会解决这个问题。（例如，参见 Martin Ford 的Architects of Intelligence一书中对他们的采访。）上述 COMET 系统探索了一种更加混合的方法，在 Antoine Bosselut 及其同事的预印本“COMET”中有所描述。另请参阅 Marcus 关于对此类混合系统的需求的预印本“AI 的下一个十年”，以及ACM 最近的通讯Don Monroe 的文章“寻求人工常识”关于这个主题，以及迄今为止部署的 AI 系统中缺乏常识之类的东西。

Reinforcing the criticality of the subject of our book, thought leaders in the deep learning community such as Yann LeCun, Yoshua Bengio, and Geoffrey Hinton have mentioned how important they think common sense will be for AI systems. Perhaps not surprisingly, they are confident that deep learning in some form will eventually account for it. (See, for example, interviews with them in the book Architects of Intelligence by Martin Ford.) The mentioned COMET system, which explores a more hybrid approach, is described in the preprint “COMET” by Antoine Bosselut and colleagues. See also the preprint “The Next Decade in AI” by Marcus on the need for hybrid systems like this, and the recent Communications of the ACM article “Seeking Artificial Common Sense” by Don Monroe on this topic and the lack of anything like common sense in deployed AI systems to date.

第 5 章：对世界的常识性理解

Chapter 5: A Commonsense Understanding of the World

从最广义上讲，本章是关于常识代理的知识需要对世界做出什么假设。（抛开常识，这与试图阐明世界的真实面目并不完全相同。）如前所述，有不同的方式来看待这个问题，强调不同的方面。在发展心理学中，研究人员通常专注于世界的更多物理方面，例如以物理因果关系为中心，空间与时间起着同样重要的作用。对于这种心理学观点，请参阅加里·马库斯的《心灵的诞生》、史蒂文·平克的《语言本能》以及伊丽莎白·斯佩尔克和凯瑟琳·金兹勒的“核心知识”。

In its broadest terms, this chapter is about what the knowledge of a commonsense agent needs to assume about the world. (This is not quite the same thing as trying to spell out what the world is really like, common sense aside.) As noted, there are different ways of looking at this, with different aspects being emphasized. In developmental psychology, researchers often concentrate on the more physical aspects of the world, with physical causality at the center, for example, and space playing as prominent a role as time. For this psychological perspective, see Gary Marcus’s The Birth of the Mind, Steven Pinker’s The Language Instinct, and Elizabeth Spelke and Katherine Kinzler’s “Core Knowledge.”

在 AI 中，系统将了解的各种事物的分解有时称为本体论；Steffen Staab 和 Rudi Studer 编写了关于该主题的厚重的本体论手册。（注意术语在哲学上有更多的形而上学内涵。）可以想象，不同领域的人工智能系统可以使用完全不同的本体（例如，考古学与内分泌学、社会学与神话学）。本章末尾 Brian Cantwell Smith 关于本体论的引述来自《人工智能的前景》第 142 页。

In AI, the breakdown of the sorts of things that a system will know about is sometimes called an ontology; Steffen Staab and Rudi Studer have produced the hefty Handbook on Ontologies on the subject. (Note that the term has a more metaphysical connotation in philosophy.) It is imagined that AI systems in different areas could work with quite different ontologies (for example, in archaeology versus endocrinology versus sociology versus mythology). Brian Cantwell Smith’s quote on ontology at the end of the chapter is from page 142 of The Promise of Artificial Intelligence.

按照本章所提倡的思路，人工智能系统的知识有时首先被分为广泛的、一般的类别，称为上层或顶级本体。（参见 Aldo Gangemi 及其同事的文章“Understanding Top-Level Ontological Distinctions”以及 Ian Niles 和 Adam Pease 的“Towards a Standard Upper Ontology”。）这个想法是想象整个主题的分类学分类，并且看看什么应该接近这个分类的顶部，在“生物”或“物理对象”之类的东西之上。

Along the lines of what was advocated in this chapter, the knowledge of an AI system is sometimes first classified into broad, general categories in what is called an upper or top-level ontology. (See the article “Understanding Top-Level Ontological Distinctions” by Aldo Gangemi and colleagues as well as “Towards a Standard Upper Ontology” by Ian Niles and Adam Pease.) The idea is to imagine a taxonomic classification of the entire subject matter, and look at what should be near the top of this taxonomy, above things like “living thing” or “physical object.”

“万物理论”是物理学家用来描述整个宇宙的统一数学描述的术语。（当然，他们的“一切”概念是针对物理世界的，不包括在线调查或甲壳虫乐队Abbey Road上的歌曲之类的东西.) 对于许多研究人员来说，常识首先和最重要的是与我们所说的内侧宏观物体有关（重点是位置、形状、外壳等）。例如，参见 Murray Shanahan 及其同事在 2020 年发表的文章“人工智能和动物常识”。“朴素物理学”（有时称为“民间物理学”）一词由帕特里克·海耶斯在他的“朴素物理学宣言”中普及，随后是续集“第二个朴素物理学宣言”。“定性物理学”一词有时被用来强调关于物理对象和属性的非数值推理，这些推理非常典型。定性物理学的大部分工作都起源于 Johan de Kleer 的想法，随后由 Ken Forbus 等人详细阐述。（见收藏阅读Daniel Weld 和 de Kleer 撰写的关于物理系统的定性推理。）对定性物理学特别感兴趣的是对空间和时间本身的推理，如 Anthony Cohn 的文章“定性空间推理的挑战”和“维护知识”关于时间间隔”，作者 James Allen。Shanahan 在其 1997 年出版的著作《解决框架问题》和 Erik Mueller 的《常识推理》第 5 章中详细探讨了惯性常识定律。它与所谓的框架问题有关，在第 8 章的注释中提到。语言的位移特性，以及它如何使人类语言使用与其他形式的动物交流如此不同，在 Derek Bickerton 的书Adam's Tongue中进行了讨论。

A “theory of everything” is the term physicists use to describe a unified mathematical account of the entire universe. (Of course, their notion of “everything” is for the physical world, and does not include things like online surveys or the songs on the Beatles’ Abbey Road.) For many researchers, common sense is first and foremost concerned with what we have called medial macro-objects (with an emphasis on location, shape, enclosure, and the like). See the 2020 article “Artificial Intelligence and the Common Sense of Animals” by Murray Shanahan and colleagues, for example. The term “naive physics” (sometimes called “folk physics”) was popularized by Patrick Hayes in his “Naive Physics Manifesto,” which was followed by a sequel, “The Second Naive Physics Manifesto.” The term “qualitative physics” is sometimes used to underscore the nonnumerical reasoning about physical objects and properties so typical of common sense. Much of the work on qualitative physics owes its origins to ideas from Johan de Kleer, subsequently elaborated by Ken Forbus, among others. (See the collection Readings in Qualitative Reasoning about Physical Systems by Daniel Weld and de Kleer.) Of special interest in regard to qualitative physics is reasoning about space and time themselves, as in the articles “The Challenge of Qualitative Spatial Reasoning” by Anthony Cohn and “Maintaining Knowledge about Temporal Intervals” by James Allen. The commonsense law of inertia is explored in detail by Shanahan in his 1997 book, Solving the Frame Problem, and chapter 5 of Erik Mueller’s Commonsense Reasoning. It is related to what is called the frame problem, taken up in the notes on chapter 8. The displacement property of language, and how it makes human language use so different from other forms of animal communication, is discussed in Derek Bickerton’s book Adam’s Tongue.

关于数量和限制，以定性方式对数量进行推理的目标——即不使用实数或大整数（例如，变量可能只取三个可能值中的一个：正数、负数或零）——是上述定性物理学工作的基础，也是下一章研究的数量级推理的基础。关于国王和骑士在棋盘上进入正方形的例子取自大卫麦卡莱斯特的“认知判断观察”。

Regarding quantities and limits, the goal of reasoning about quantities in a qualitative way—that is, without the use of real numbers or large integers (where, for instance, variables might take on only one of three possible values: positive, negative, or zero)—is at the root of the work in qualitative physics noted above and the order of magnitude reasoning examined in the next chapter. The example about kings and knights getting to squares on a chessboard is taken from David McAllester’s “Observations on Cognitive Judgments.”

朴素心理学（类比朴素物理学）在安迪·克拉克的文章“从民间心理学到朴素心理学”和斯图尔特·瓦特的“朴素朴素心理学宣言”一文中进行了探讨。杰瑞·霍布斯 (Jerry Hobbs) 和安德鲁·戈登 (Andrew Gordon) 于 2005 年发表的论文“Toward a Large-Scale Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology for Metacognition”以及阿南德·拉奥 (Anand Rao) 更早的一篇论文提出了将代理人建模为受信念、欲望和意图支配的事物的想法和 Michael Georgef，标题为“在 BDI 架构中建模 Rational Agents”。对“人们如何思考人们的想法”的更全面的描述出现在《常识心理学的形式理论》中戈登和霍布斯。意图本身有时被视为衍生属性，或某些信念和目标的组合，如 Philip Cohen 和 HJL 在 1990 年的文章“意图是选择与承诺”中所见。另一个被视为源自信念的属性是知识或认知能力，伊夫·莱斯佩兰斯 (Yves Lespérance) 和他的同事在Studia Logica文章“情境微积分中的能力和知识”中考虑到了这一点。艾莉森·戈普尼克 (Alison Gopnik) 和珍妮特·阿斯廷顿 (Janet Astington) 在“儿童对表征变化的理解”中讨论了儿童需要达到一定年龄才能意识到人们可能会按照错误的信念行事的观点。John Searle 的Expression and Meaning涵盖了言语行为，以及 1979 年 Cohen 和 C. Raymond Perrault 发表的文章“基于计划的言语行为理论的要素”中的 AI 应用。Cohen 和 HJL 在“团队合作”一文中讨论了代理人团队之间共同意图的想法，Searle 在他的“集体意图和行动”一文中讨论了这一想法。有关多主体群体的更广泛视角——即所谓的“朴素社会学”——请参阅 Michael Wooldridge 的著作《多主体系统简介》。

Naive psychology (by analogy with naive physics) is explored in the articles “From Folk Psychology to Naive Psychology” by Andy Clark and “A Brief Naive Psychology Manifesto” by Stuart Watt. The idea of modeling an agent as something governed by beliefs, desires, and intentions is presented in the 2005 paper “Toward a Large-Scale Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology for Metacognition” by Jerry Hobbs and Andrew Gordon, and an earlier one by Anand Rao and Michael Georgeff, titled “Modeling Rational Agents within a BDI-Architecture.” A more comprehensive account of “how people think people think” appears in A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology by Gordon and Hobbs. Intentions themselves are sometimes seen as derivative properties, or combinations of certain beliefs and goals, as seen in the 1990 article “Intention Is Choice with Commitment” by Philip Cohen and HJL. Another property seen as deriving from beliefs is that of know-how or epistemic ability, considered in the Studia Logica article “Ability and Knowing How in the Situation Calculus” by Yves Lespérance and company. The idea that children need to be of a certain age before they realize that people may be acting on false beliefs is discussed by Alison Gopnik and Janet Astington in “Children’s Understanding of Representational Change.” Speech acts are covered in John Searle’s Expression and Meaning, and as an application for AI in the 1979 article “Elements of a Plan-Based Theory of Speech Acts” by Cohen and C. Raymond Perrault. The idea of joint intentions among a team of agents is discussed by Cohen and HJL in “Teamwork,” and Searle in his “Collective Intentions and Actions.” For a broader perspective on multiagent groups—that is, on what might be called “naive sociology”—see Michael Wooldridge’s book An Introduction to Multiagent Systems.

AI 中因果关系的研究主要与 Judea Pearl 在他的两本书——因果关系和The Book of Why（与 DanaMackenzie)——并与 Joseph Halpern 合作。（请参阅 Halpern 的实际因果关系。）重点在于从一组给定的基本因果事实（通常以图形形式表示）中得出适当的结论，并将因果关系与单纯的统计相关性区分开来。

The study of causality in AI is mainly associated with the work of Judea Pearl in his two books—Causality and The Book of Why (with Dana Mackenzie)—and in collaboration with Joseph Halpern. (See Halpern’s Actual Causality.) The emphasis there is on deriving appropriate conclusions from a given set of basic causal facts (often represented in graphical form) and distinguishing causality from mere statistical correlation.

第6章：常识性知识

Chapter 6: Commonsense Knowledge

在上一章的分析中，世界被认为是由具有随时间变化的属性的事物构成的。本章关注的是我们可能对这些事物及其属性了解多少，尤其是我们可能对它们形成哪些想法或概念。

In the analysis of the previous chapter, the world is taken to be made of things with properties that change over time. This chapter is concerned with what we might know about these things and their properties, and in particular, what ideas or concepts we might form about them.

认为一个概念可以通过某种定义来完全表征的观点是一种需要摒弃的常见误解。虽然生日派对确实是一个以庆祝某人生日为目的的派对，但生日派对的概念更进一步：有蛋糕、蜡烛和歌曲（在西方传统中， 至少）。像 Willard Van Orman Quine（从逻辑观点来看）和 Ludwig Wittgenstein（在他的哲学研究中）这样的哲学家反对根据绝对定义来理解概念，并且本章的大部分内容检查了必须考虑的超出必要和充分条件的内容考虑诸如生日聚会之类的事情时的情况。

The notion that a concept can be fully characterized by a definition of some sort is a common misconception that needs to be abandoned. While it is certainly true that a birthday party is no more and no less than a party whose purpose is to celebrate the birthday of someone, the idea of a birthday party goes further: there’s the cake, candles, and song (in the Western tradition, at least). Philosophers like Willard Van Orman Quine (in From a Logical Point of View) and Ludwig Wittgenstein (in his Philosophical Investigations) have argued against understanding concepts in terms of categorical definitions, and much of the chapter examined what had to be considered beyond necessary and sufficient conditions when thinking about things such as birthday parties.

这里的大部分探索都受到了 Marvin Minsky 的启发。从这个领域开始，明斯基对类人推理的关注使他的工作与他的同事约翰·麦卡锡的工作区分开来，正如他在他的《心灵协会》第 323 页上所说的那样：“麦卡锡更关心为推理建立逻辑和数学基础，而我是更多地涉及我们如何使用模式识别和类比进行实际推理的理论。” 明斯基的著作提出了构建基于知识的人工智能系统的替代想法——其中最有影响力的想法之一是他的框架系统概念。此处的扩展引用来自他 1974 年 6 月的麻省理工学院人工智能实验室备忘录 306（“表示知识的框架”），可在线获取并在 RJB 和 HJL 中转载知识表示书中的读物。有关明斯基整体观点的有趣且更全面的说明，请参阅他的《心灵社会》一书。关于大象和树木的例子取自 RJB 的“我对树木撒了谎”。

Much of the exploration here was inspired by the work of Marvin Minsky. From the beginning of the field, Minsky’s concern with humanlike reasoning differentiated his work from his colleague John McCarthy’s, as he stated on page 323 of his Society of Mind: “McCarthy was more concerned with establishing logical and mathematical foundations for reasoning, while I was more involved with theories of how we actually reason using pattern recognition and analogy.” Minsky’s writing suggested alternative ideas for building knowledge-based AI systems—one of the most influential of which was his notion of frame systems. The extended quote here is from his MIT AI Laboratory Memo 306 from June 1974 (“A Framework for Representing Knowledge”), available online as well as reprinted in RJB and HJL’s Readings in Knowledge Representation book. For an interesting and more comprehensive account of Minsky’s overall view, see his Society of Mind book. The example concerning elephants and trees was taken from RJB’s “I Lied about the Trees.”

以刻板的方式记住情境，然后根据先前的经验，调整记忆的结构以适应当前情况的一般概念是一个重要的概念，并且已经巩固了 AI 中的一条重要线索，尽管它的价值有些被低估了。这种基于记忆的推理概念也融入了 Roger Schank 和他的学生的研究。这在 Schank 的“语言和记忆”文章和动态记忆书以及他与 Robert Abelson 合着的书Scripts, Plans, Goals, and Understanding中有所介绍。在可以作为这种思路的总结中，Jaime Carbonell 和 Steven Minton 提出了一个经验推理假设（这也可能是明斯基写的）在他们的“隐喻和常识推理”一文中：“在平凡的、经验丰富的反复出现的情况下进行推理，在性质上不同于在更抽象的、实验设计的或其他方面明显的正式的、演绎的推理。非经常性情况（例如某些数学或解谜领域）。” Janet Kolodner 和其他人通过他们所谓的基于案例的推理，将基于记忆的推理扩展到与医疗诊断、设计、冲突解决、规划和其他领域相关的问题解决情况。请参阅她 1993 年出版的《基于案例的推理》一书。

The general notion of remembering situations in a stereotyped way and then, having been reminded of prior experience, adapting remembered structures to the current situation is an important one, and has undergirded a significant, if somewhat undervalued, thread in AI. This memory-based notion of reasoning also infuses the research of Roger Schank and his students. This is covered in Schank’s “Language and Memory” article and Dynamic Memory book as well as his book Scripts, Plans, Goals, and Understanding with Robert Abelson. In what could serve as a summation of this line of thinking, Jaime Carbonell and Steven Minton proposed an experiential reasoning hypothesis (which could just as well have been written by Minsky) in their “Metaphor and Commonsense Reasoning” piece: “Reasoning in mundane, experience-rich recurrent situations is qualitatively different from formal, deductive reasoning evident in more abstract, experimentally contrived, or otherwise nonrecurrent situations (such as some mathematical or puzzle-solving domains).” Janet Kolodner and others extended memory-based reasoning to problem-solving situations related to medical diagnosis, design, conflict resolution, planning, and other areas, through what they called case-based reasoning. See her 1993 book, Case-Based Reasoning.

现在应该很明显，很多概念和范畴都与人类语言和思维有关，重要的相关思想来自心理学和哲学。例如，原型的概念主要出现在心理学文献中。请参阅 Douglas Medin 和 Edward Smith 的评论文章“概念和概念形成”，以及Eleanor Rosch 和 Barbara Lloyd 编辑的Cognition and Categorization卷。Jaakko Hintikka 在他的知识与信仰中讨论了知道那个和知道谁之间的区别。Bertrand Russell 关于名称、名词短语和个人的想法可以在他的“On Denoting”一文中找到，并将对我们在接下来的两章中如何使用符号来表示个人产生影响。

As should now be evident, much about concepts and categories relates to human language and thinking, and important relevant ideas come from psychology and philosophy. The idea of prototypes, for example, is mainly seen in the psychological literature. See the review article “Concepts and Concept Formation” by Douglas Medin and Edward Smith, and the volume Cognition and Categorization edited by Eleanor Rosch and Barbara Lloyd. The distinction between knowing that and knowing who is discussed by Jaakko Hintikka in his Knowledge and Belief. Bertrand Russell’s idea regarding names, noun phrases, and individuals can be found in his “On Denoting” article and will have an impact on how we use symbols for individuals in the next two chapters.

最后一小节中 Brian Cantwell Smith 的引述来自他的《人工智能的希望》一书的第 63 页。罗德·布鲁克斯 (Rod Brooks) 关于世界及其模型的陈述转述自他的“没有代表的情报”的第 139 页。始终可以进一步细化或注释概念的想法有时被称为精化容忍度——麦卡锡在其 1998 年的论文“精化容忍度”中讨论的一个概念。关于分级概念和属性的想法，只持有一定程度，请参阅 Lotfi 的 George Klir 和 Bo Yuan 的论文集Zadeh，标题为模糊集、模糊逻辑和模糊系统。有关在 AI 中使用索引知识的更多信息，请参阅 1995 年 Yves Lespérance 和 HJL 在人工智能中发表的文章“Indexical Knowledge and Robot Action” 。本章前面提到的儿童词典是 John Trevaskis 和 Robin Hyman 的Boys' and Girls' First Dictionary。思考儿童如何理解概念也与第 10 章相关。

The Brian Cantwell Smith quote in the final subsection is from page 63 of his The Promise of Artificial Intelligence book. Rod Brooks’s statement about the world and its models is paraphrased from page 139 of his “Intelligence without Representation.” The idea that it should always be possible to further refine or annotate concepts is sometimes known as elaboration tolerance—a notion discussed by McCarthy in his 1998 paper, “Elaboration Tolerance.” On the idea of graded concepts and properties holding only to a degree, see George Klir and Bo Yuan’s collection of papers by Lotfi Zadeh, titled Fuzzy Sets, Fuzzy Logic, and Fuzzy Systems. For more on the use of indexical knowledge in AI, see the 1995 article “Indexical Knowledge and Robot Action” by Yves Lespérance and HJL in Artificial Intelligence. The children’s dictionary mentioned earlier in the chapter is John Trevaskis and Robin Hyman’s Boys’ and Girls’ First Dictionary. Thinking about how concepts are understood by children will also be relevant in chapter 10.

第 7 章：表示和推理，第一部分

Chapter 7: Representation and Reasoning, Part I

本章和下一章关注常识知识的符号表示以及定义在它们之上的推理操作。人工智能的这个子领域通常称为知识表示和推理。该领域的早期研究文章集是RJB 和 HJL 的Readings in Knowledge Representation一书。最近（和高级）的评论文章合集是由 Frank van Harmelen 及其同事编辑的Handbook of Knowledge Representation。本章和下一章中出现的大多数问题在RJB 和 HJL 的教科书Knowledge Representation and Reasoning中有更深入的介绍。

This chapter and the next are concerned with symbolic representations of commonsense knowledge along with the reasoning operations defined over them. This subarea of AI is usually called knowledge representation and reasoning. An early collection of research articles in this area is the Readings in Knowledge Representation book by RJB and HJL. A more recent (and advanced) collection of review articles is the Handbook of Knowledge Representation edited by Frank van Harmelen and colleagues. Most of the issues seen in this chapter and the next are covered in more depth in the textbook Knowledge Representation and Reasoning by RJB and HJL.

本章介绍的世界和概念模型侧重于个体事物及其与其他事物的联系。这种面向连接的表示方式在 1970 年代在语义（或概念或关联）网络的一般保护下变得非常流行。尼古拉斯·芬德勒 (Nicholas Findler) 编辑的著作《关联网络》(Associative Networks)有一系列相关文章，RJB 的“论语义网络的认识论地位”贡献了截至 1970 年代末该领域的调查。一些哲学家查尔斯·桑德斯·皮尔士 (Charles Sanders Peirce) 在 20 世纪早期提出了以这种方式使用网络的最初想法；参见查尔斯·S·皮尔士的《存在图》一书由唐·罗伯茨 (Don Roberts) 进行的观察。在 1960 年代直接导致对 AI 进行广泛探索的更有影响力的工作中，有 Ross Quillian 的工作，如他在“语义记忆”一文中所见。正如 Quillian 指出的那样，由于它们的连接性，语义网络适合基于路径的处理，例如沿着网络中的链接传递标记以检测项目之间的连接。这后来在 Scott Fahlman 的NETL一书中和 Stuart Shapiro 的文章“语义网络中基于路径和基于节点的推理”中讨论的系统中得到了很好的利用。

The world and conceptual models introduced in this chapter focus on individual things as well as their links to other things. This connection-oriented style of representation became quite popular in the 1970s under the general umbrella of semantic (or conceptual or associative) networks. Nicholas Findler’s edited book Associative Networks has a collection of related articles, and RJB’s “On the Epistemological Status of Semantic Networks” contribution surveys that field as of the late 1970s. Some credit philosopher Charles Sanders Peirce with the original idea of using networks in this way early in the twentieth century; see the book The Existential Graphs of Charles S. Peirce by Don Roberts for that observation. Among the more influential work of the 1960s that led directly to extensive exploration in AI was that of Ross Quillian, as seen in his “Semantic Memory” article. As Quillian noted, because of their connectivity, semantic networks lend themselves to path-based processing, such as passing markers along links in the network to detect connections between items. This was later exploited to good effect in the systems discussed in the book NETL by Scott Fahlman and the article “Path-Based and Node-Based Inference in Semantic Networks” by Stuart Shapiro.

此处介绍的语义网络的一个基本特征是概念的分类组织和随之而来的属性继承。但就节点和链接而言，看似简单的想法实际上隐藏了许多微妙的概念陷阱。在他颇具影响力的“链接中有什么”一文中，William Woods 检查了一些关于此类网络中的链接的直觉但错误的假设。RJB 随后在他的“概念中有什么”和“‘IS-A’是什么和不是什么”中对网络表示进行了相关观察和其他挑战。

A fundamental feature of semantic networks as presented here is the taxonomic organization of concepts and attendant inheritance of properties. But what looks like a simple idea in terms of nodes and links actually hides a number of subtle conceptual traps. In his influential “What’s in a Link,” William Woods examined a number of intuitive but wrongheaded assumptions made about links in such networks. RJB followed with related observations and additional challenges for network representations in his “What’s in a Concept” and “What ‘IS-A’ Is and Isn’t.”

要了解所涉及的一些问题，请考虑SpacePt#25本章世界模型中使用的符号。这个符号是代表波士顿的某个特定位置，恰好是Event#23（约翰的出生）发生的地方，还是它实际上代表发生的位置Event#23，恰好在波士顿的某个地方？在伍兹的术语中，location从Event#23到的联系在前者中SpacePt#25是断言的，而在后者中是结构性的。如果我们发现自己错了，发现约翰实际上出生在匹兹堡，那么差异就会显现出来。在前一种情况下，我们希望将location链接从Event#23go 更改为不同的符号——比如说，SpacePt#37——代表匹兹堡的某个地方；在后一种情况下，我们希望保持location链接不变，但将enclosingCity链接从SpacePt#25go 更改为代表 Pittsburgh 的符号。（需要明确的是，我们没有在本章中详细说明使用哪种解释，或者是否有其他解释，或者这可能会改变人们的信仰。这只会在附加章节中讨论，我们尝试更准确地说是世界模型的节点和链接所携带的总信息。）

To get a sense of some of the issues involved, consider the symbol SpacePt#25 used in the world model of this chapter. Does this symbol represent some specific location in Boston that happens to be where Event#23 (John’s birth) took place, or does it actually represent the location where Event#23 took place, which happens to be somewhere in Boston? In the terminology of Woods, the location link from Event#23 to SpacePt#25 is assertional in the former case and structural in the latter. The difference shows up if we were to discover that we were mistaken, and that John was actually born in Pittsburgh. In the former case, we would want to change the location link from Event#23 to go to a different symbol—say, SpacePt#37—standing for somewhere in Pittsburgh; in the latter case, we would want to leave the location link as is, but change the enclosingCity link from SpacePt#25 to go to the symbol standing for Pittsburgh. (To be clear, we have not spelled out in this chapter which interpretation to use, or if there are others, or where this might make a difference in what is believed. This will only be taken up in the bonus chapter, where we try to be more precise about the total information carried by the nodes and links of a world model.)

从这些分析和考虑中出现了广为人知的 KL-ONE 知识表示系统，由 RJB 和 James Schmolze 在“KL-ONE 知识表示系统概述”中记录，最终为广泛的工作奠定了基础后来被称为描述逻辑。Franz Baader 及其同事在他们的《描述逻辑手册》中提供了一个全面的观点。本章中世界模型和概念模型之间的区别源自描述逻辑中所谓的 ABox和TBox之间的相似区别（A表示断言，T表示术语). 第 6 章的明斯基框架思想与描述逻辑中的符号表达式密切相关。Charles Fillmore 的“Frame Semantics”和 Patrick Hayes 的“The Logic of Frames”讨论了框架结构的解释。这项工作还与早期对所谓的案例框架的思考有关语言学——菲尔莫尔在该领域做出了突出贡献。（参见他 1968 年的论文“The Case for Case”。）这是这里和 KL-ONE 系统中使用的角色概念的重要基础。应该注意的是，KL-ONE 远远超出了此处提供的表示，它具有丰富的所谓结构描述语言，用于捕获概念角色之间的关系（如 RJB 和 Schmolze 论文中所讨论的）。

Out of these analyses and considerations emerged the widely known KL-ONE knowledge representation system, documented by RJB and James Schmolze in “An Overview of the KL-ONE Knowledge Representation System,” which ultimately set the stage for an extensive body of work on what came to be known as description logics. Franz Baader and colleagues offer a comprehensive view in their Description Logic Handbook. The distinction in this chapter between a world model and a conceptual model derives from a similar one made in description logics between what are called the ABox and TBox (A for assertion, and T for terminology). The idea of a Minsky frame from chapter 6 is closely related to the symbolic expressions in description logics. Interpretations of frame structures are discussed in Charles Fillmore’s “Frame Semantics” and Patrick Hayes’s “The Logic of Frames.” This work is also related to earlier thinking on what were called case frames in linguistics—an area in which Fillmore is a prominent contributor. (See his 1968 paper “The Case for Case.”) This was an important foundation for the notion of a role, as used here and in the KL-ONE system. It should be noted that KL-ONE went well beyond the representation presented here in having a rich language of so-called structural descriptions for capturing relationships among the roles of a concept (as discussed in the RJB and Schmolze paper).

这个谱系中一个更复杂的表示框架是 KRL，在 1977 年 Daniel Bobrow 和 Terry Winograd 的文章“KRL 概述，一种知识表示语言”中有很好的记录。KRL 语言有许多有趣的结构，包括一种类似于此处考虑的注释样式。KRL 还探讨了本章中涉及的一些元层次表示和推理。

One of the more sophisticated representation frameworks in this lineage was KRL, nicely documented in the 1977 article “An Overview of KRL, a Knowledge Representation Language” by Daniel Bobrow and Terry Winograd. The KRL language had a number of interesting constructs, including a style of annotation similar to the one considered here. KRL also explored some of the metalevel representation and reasoning touched on in this chapter.

原型和范例在第 6 章中进行了讨论。如前所述，重建记忆的想法可以追溯到弗雷德里克·巴特利特爵士 (Sir Frederic Bartlett) 的著作《记忆》 (另请参阅附加章节)。关于目击者记忆的重要工作记录在伊丽莎白·洛夫图斯 (Elizabeth Loftus) 的《目击者证词》一书中。

Prototypes and exemplars were discussed in chapter 6. As mentioned, the idea of reconstructive memory goes back to Sir Frederic Bartlett’s book Remembering (and see also the bonus chapter). Important work on eyewitness memory is documented in the book Eyewitness Testimony by Elizabeth Loftus.

最后，正如本章末尾所暗示的，关于世界的已知信息会不断修正和变化，因为默认假设被发现是站不住脚的。Matthew Ginsberg 的Readings in Nonmonotonic Reasoning强调了在典型性假设下对异常情况进行推理时出现的棘手问题。没有任何后果的简单更新相当容易处理，但许多推论所依赖的基本信念的变化可能很复杂。围绕信念修正的实质性研究领域探索了这个空间。特别值得注意的是Belief Revision这本书由 Peter Gärdenfors 编辑，Bernhard Nebel 撰写的文章“A Knowledge Level Analysis of Belief Revision”。人工智能系统中对信念改变的支持通常是通过所谓的真相维护系统来实现的，Johan de Kleer 在“基于假设的 TMS”中和 Jon Doyle 在“真相维护系统”中都有介绍——两者都是对人工智能的贡献。

Finally, as hinted toward the end of the chapter, what is known about the world is subject to constant amending and changing, as default assumptions are discovered to be untenable. Matthew Ginsberg’s Readings in Nonmonotonic Reasoning highlights the thorny issues that arise in reasoning about exceptional cases under assumptions of typicality. Simple updates with no ramifications are fairly easy to handle, but changes to underlying beliefs on which many inferences have rested can be complicated. A substantive area of research around belief revision explores this space. Of particular note are the book Belief Revision edited by Peter Gärdenfors and the article “A Knowledge Level Analysis of Belief Revision” by Bernhard Nebel. Support for belief change in AI systems has often been implemented through what are called truth maintenance systems, covered by Johan de Kleer in “An Assumption-Based TMS” and Jon Doyle in “A Truth Maintenance System”—both as contributions to Artificial Intelligence.

第 8 章：表示和推理，第二部分

Chapter 8: Representation and Reasoning, Part II

虽然前一章主要关注常识知识可能需要的表示类型（即，世界模型和概念模型），本章主要是关于推理：计算给定这些模型应该相信的世界。前提是需要一种“微积分种类”（借用第 4 章中莱布尼茨的用语），它不仅会产生适当的信念，而且如附加章节中所述，它可以“以完全自动化的方式进行例行计算，无需太多努力或仔细监控，即使是在庞大的知识库上也是如此。”

While the previous chapter was mainly concerned with the kinds of representations that might be needed for commonsense knowledge (that is, world models and conceptual models), this chapter is mainly about reasoning: computing what should be believed about the world given these models. The premise is that a “species of calculus” is needed (to use Leibniz’s phrase from chapter 4) that not only results in appropriate beliefs but rather, as stated in the bonus chapter, that can be “computed routinely in a completely automated way, without much effort or careful monitoring, even over enormous knowledge bases.”

第一步是想出一种符号语言来表示要相信的命题。这里介绍的语言 L 是第 4 章中提到的一阶谓词演算的一种方言，但只有一元和二元谓词，并且常量以特殊方式处理，类似于 HJL 和 Gerhard Lakemeyer 中标准名称的处理知识库的逻辑。（关于谓词演算的介绍可以在 Herbert Enderton 的A Mathematical Introduction to Logic和Eliott Mendelson 的Introduction to Mathematical Logic两本书中找到。）实际上，因为它使用“after”这个词来谈论事件和变化，L更像是情境演算的一种方言，约翰·麦卡锡在他的“情境、行动和因果法则”中引入的语言。情境演算后来被 Raymond Reiter 及其同事改编和形式化，如 Reiter 2001 年出版的书《行动中的知识》和 Fangzhen Lin 2008 年的文章“情境演算”中所述。根据 McCarthy 和 Patrick Hayes 的“人工智能立场的一些哲学问题”论文，可能需要进一步扩展 L 来处理时间和模态等概念。

The first step is to come up with a symbolic language to represent the propositions to be believed. The language L introduced here is a dialect of the first-order predicate calculus noted in chapter 4, but with unary and binary predicates only, and where constants are handled in a special way, similar to the treatment of standard names in HJL and Gerhard Lakemeyer’s The Logic of Knowledge Bases. (Introductions to the predicate calculus can be found in the books A Mathematical Introduction to Logic by Herbert Enderton and Introduction to Mathematical Logic by Elliott Mendelson.) Actually, because of its use of the word “after” to talk about events and change, L is more like a dialect of the situation calculus, the language introduced by John McCarthy in his “Situations, Actions, and Causal Laws.” The situation calculus was later adapted and formalized by Raymond Reiter and colleagues, as documented in Reiter’s 2001 book, Knowledge in Action, and the 2008 article “Situation Calculus” by Fangzhen Lin. Further extensions to L may be necessary to deal with notions such as time and modality, as per McCarthy and Patrick Hayes’s “Some Philosophical Problems from the Standpoint of Artificial Intelligence” paper.

下一步是将世界模型理解为仅表示世界的基本属性，并使用涉及 L 公式的特殊子句来表示从中导出的属性。这些子句使整个表示系统看起来更像 Datalog，一旦考虑到数字和序列，就像 Prolog，最常被视为一种编程语言。Datalog 记录在Serge Abiteboul 及其同事的《数据库基础》一书中。Prolog 的历史在 Alain Colmerauer 和 Philippe Roussel 的文章“Prolog 的诞生”中有所介绍，其编程方面在 Willliam Clocksin 和 Christopher Mellish 的 Programming in Prolog 以及 HJL 的 Thinking as Computation中有所介绍。

The next step was to understand a world model as representing only the basic properties of the world and use special clauses involving formulas of L for properties to be derived from them. These clauses make the overall representation system look more like Datalog, and once numbers and sequences are taken into account, like Prolog, most often seen as a programming language. Datalog is documented in the book Foundations of Databases by Serge Abiteboul and colleagues. The history of Prolog is covered in the article “The Birth of Prolog” by Alain Colmerauer and Philippe Roussel, and its programming aspects in Willliam Clocksin and Christopher Mellish’s Programming in Prolog as well as HJL’s Thinking as Computation.

当谈到用逻辑术语来推理变化时，可能出现的最重要的问题就是所谓的框架问题。（参见 McCarthy 和 Hayes 的“Some Philosophical Problems”以及 Murray Shanahan 的解决框架问题。）简而言之，问题是如何得出关于什么不受事件影响的结论，前提是只处理受影响的事情。本章提出的变化推理方式是基于赖特在其1991年的文章“情境演算中的框架问题”中首先提出的框架问题的解决方案，并在Knowledge in Action中进行了阐述。粗略地说，这涉及对事件的逻辑量化——也就是说，能够说唯一影响某个属性的事件是某些要明确命名的事件。对于 Reiter，这些陈述成为逻辑公理（称为后继状态公理) 进行推理；在我们的例子中，它们变成了某种形式的推导子句。

When it comes to reasoning about change in logical terms, perhaps the foremost issue that arises is what is called the frame problem. (See McCarthy and Hayes’s “Some Philosophical Problems” as well as Murray Shanahan’s Solving the Frame Problem.) In a nutshell, the problem is how to draw conclusions about what is unaffected by events, given premises that deal only with what is affected. The way of reasoning about change proposed in this chapter is based on the solution to the frame problem first presented by Reiter in his 1991 article “The Frame Problem in the Situation Calculus” and elaborated in Knowledge in Action. Roughly speaking, this involves a logical quantification over events—that is, being able to say that the only events affecting a certain property are certain ones to be named explicitly. For Reiter, these statements become logical axioms (called successor state axioms) to be reasoned with; in our case, they become derivation clauses of a certain form.

（请注意，这种处理变化的方式并没有讨论在没有进一步干预的情况下会发生什么事件——也就是说，正在进行的外生过程。这需要将此类过程表示为复杂事件，例如，在语言 Golog 中情境演算的上下文。有关详细信息，请参阅 Reiter 的书。）

(Note that this way of handling change does not talk about what events will take place without further intervention—that is, the ongoing exogenous processes. This requires a representation for such processes as complex events as seen, for example, in the language Golog in the context of the situation calculus. See Reiter’s book for details.)

谈到规划，麦卡锡在他的“情境、行动和因果律”中首次将其描述为一种逻辑推理形式。从那时起，自动化规划在 AI 领域有着悠久的历史，出现了许多专门的表示和推理方案，其中有影响力的 STRIPS 表示，由 Richard Fikes 和 Nils Nilsson 在“STRIPS：应用定理的新方法”中介绍证明解决问题。” 其中一些专门的规划方案在 Malik Ghallab、Dana Nau 和 Paolo Traverso 的教科书《自动化规划》中有所介绍。

Turning to planning, the first characterization of it as a form of logical reasoning is due to McCarthy in his “Situations, Actions, and Causal Laws.” Since then, automated planning has had a long history in AI, with a number of specialized representation and reasoning schemes, among which was the influential STRIPS representation, introduced by Richard Fikes and Nils Nilsson in “STRIPS: A New Approach to the Application of Theorem Proving to Problem Solving.” Some of these specialized planning schemes are covered in the textbook Automated Planning by Malik Ghallab, Dana Nau and Paolo Traverso.

如前所述，除了对行为的影响进行推理之外，还有必要对它们的先决条件进行推理，这对 Reiter 来说是所谓的前提公理，我们将其描述为另一个派生属性。这就提出了麦卡锡在他的“人工智能的认识论问题”中所说的资格问题：粗略地说，如何对行动的先决条件进行分类，而不必列出原则上可能出现的所有各种可能非常遥远的绊脚石。这是第 6 章中讨论的问题的一个特例，即想要做出直截了当的、不合格的陈述，但也希望能够随着时间的推移对其进行详细说明和注释。

As noted, in addition to reasoning about the effects of actions, it is necessary to reason about their prerequisites, which show up for Reiter as so-called precondition axioms, and which we characterized as yet another derived property. This raises what McCarthy called in his “Epistemological Problems of Artificial Intelligence” the qualification problem: roughly, how to categorize prerequisites of actions without having to list all the various, perhaps quite-remote stumbling blocks that could arise in principle. This is a special case of the problem discussed in chapter 6 of wanting to make blunt, unqualified statements, but also wanting to be able to elaborate and annotate them over time.

最后，文中提出的回答一般性问题的方法，例如“石榴能放在洗衣篮里吗？” 通过实例化所涉及的概念然后询问有关假设的个人的问题与 Philip Johnson-Laird 假设使用心智模型回答问题的方式有关，在奖金章节中进行了讨论。

Finally, the way proposed in the text for answering generic questions such as “Would a pomegranate fit inside a laundry basket?” by instantiating the concepts involved and then asking questions about the hypothesized individuals is related to the way Philip Johnson-Laird postulates answering questions using mental models, discussed in the bonus chapter.

第 9 章：行动常识

Chapter 9: Common Sense in Action

从某种意义上说，本章是前四章的高潮。它试图展示常识性知识的符号表示和对它们的计算操作如何在代理人以常识性方式处理意外事件时需要做出的决策中发挥决定性作用。

This chapter is, in a way, a culmination of the previous four chapters. It attempts to show how symbolic representations of commonsense knowledge and the computational operations over them can play a determining role in the decisions an agent will need to make when dealing in a commonsensical way with something unanticipated.

本章中展示的图片是代理人在执行某种计划时遇到问题的图片。代理人必须离开计划的执行并决定做什么，同时考虑计划的结构、关于当前情况的发现以及对世界的一般常识。

The picture presented in the chapter was that of an agent encountering a problem while following a plan of some sort. The agent had to step away from the execution of the plan and decide what to do, taking into account the structure of the plan, what had been discovered about the current situation, and general commonsense knowledge of the world.

在这本书中，计划被认为是简单的行动或者它们的序列。但这显然太有限了。登上飞机飞往某个地方的计划可能涉及前往机场的适当登机口，但该登机口通常不会在计划中命名。相反，该计划将指定要在机场执行的传感或知识生成操作，以确定使用哪个登机口。（HJL 和 Gerhard Lakemeyer 在他们的“认知机器人”文章中讨论了此类动作。）这可能会触发世界模型的添加以合并新信息。这种可能涉及分支和循环的计划在 AI 中有时被称为广义计划。请参阅 Sergio Jiménez 及其同事的“广义规划回顾”。

In this book, plans were taken to be simple actions or perhaps sequences of them. But this is clearly too limited. A plan to board an airplane to fly somewhere might involve going to the appropriate gate at the airport, but that gate would normally not be named in the plan. Instead, the plan would specify a sensing or knowledge-producing action to be executed at the airport to find out which gate to use. (HJL and Gerhard Lakemeyer talk about such actions in their “Cognitive Robotics” article.) This might trigger an addition to the world model to incorporate the new information. A plan of this sort, which can involve branches and loops, is sometimes called a generalized plan in AI. See “A Review of Generalized Planning” by Sergio Jiménez and colleagues.

以同时考虑成本和收益的方式决定做什么的想法是决策理论的支柱。有关介绍，请参阅 Martin Peterson 的An Introduction to Decision Theory一书。其中一些工作本质上是哲学或经济学的，但其中一些是在人工智能范围内，并以计算的方式处理问题；一个例子是 Eric Horvitz 和他的合作者的“专家系统和人工智能中的决策理论”。与这里特别相关的是关于决策理论规划的工作，例如 Craig Boutilier 及其同事的文章“决策理论规划”以及 Leslie Pack Kaelbling 及其同事的“在部分可观察的随机域中进行规划和行动”。请注意，虽然这人工智能工作强调计划的质量和领域的不确定性，它确实倾向于淡化一般常识知识在计划过程中的作用。

The idea of deciding what to do in a way that takes both cost and benefit into account is a mainstay of decision theory; see Martin Peterson’s An Introduction to Decision Theory book for an introduction. Some of this work is philosophical or economic in nature, but some of it is within AI and deals with the issue in computational terms; an example is “Decision Theory in Expert Systems and Artificial Intelligence” by Eric Horvitz and his collaborators. Especially relevant here is the work on decision-theoretic planning, such as in the article “Decision-Theoretic Planning” by Craig Boutilier and colleagues as well as “Planning and Acting in Partially Observable Stochastic Domains” by Leslie Pack Kaelbling and colleagues. Note that while this AI work emphasizes the quality of plans and uncertainty about the domain, it does tend to downplay the role of general commonsense knowledge in the planning process.

本章的大部分推理涉及在发生意外情况时使用常识性知识来修改计划。这个过程有时称为计划修复。（例如，参见 Kristian Hammond 的论文“Explaining and Repairing Plans That Fail”和 Subbarao Kambhampati 和 James Hendler 的“A Validation-Structure-Based Theory of Plan Modification and Reuse”）。有趣的是，从某种意义上说，计划修复作为一项计算任务实际上比计划本身更难，因为至少在最坏的情况下，它仍然需要从头开始计划，正如作者在“计划重用与计划生成”一文中所观察到的Bernhard Nebel 和 Jana Koehler。

The bulk of the reasoning in this chapter involves using commonsense knowledge to modify a plan when something unexpected happens. This process is sometimes called plan repair. (See, for example, the papers “Explaining and Repairing Plans That Fail” by Kristian Hammond and “A Validation-Structure-Based Theory of Plan Modification and Reuse” by Subbarao Kambhampati and James Hendler). Interestingly, there is a sense in which plan repair is actually more difficult as a computational task than planning itself since in the worst case at least, it can still require planning from scratch, as observed in the article “Plan Reuse versus Plan Generation” by Bernhard Nebel and Jana Koehler.

本章最后声称，将常识视为具有常识的主体的认知架构中的主要驱动力是不恰当的。但是这个架构应该是什么样子呢？这还远不清楚。有关其他研究人员对此不得不说的话的最新回顾，请参阅 Iuliia Kotseruba 和 John Tsotsos 的 2020 年调查“认知架构 40 年”。

The chapter concludes by claiming that it was not appropriate to think of common sense as the main driving force within the cognitive architecture of an agent with common sense. But what should this architecture look like, then? It’s far from clear. For a recent review of what other researchers have had to say on this, see the 2020 survey “40 Years of Cognitive Architectures” by Iuliia Kotseruba and John Tsotsos.

第 10 章：实施步骤

Chapter 10: Steps toward Implementation

本章讲述了用常识构建计算机系统的实际困难。这个问题被分解为建立推理机和建立知识库。对于常识推理者， Ł ukasz Kaiser 和 Ilya Sutskever 的文章“神经 GPU 学习算法”中讨论了使用神经网络学习如何执行符号运算（例如常识推理中涉及的运算）的想法。然而，本章的大部分内容都是关于建立知识库的。

This chapter was about the practical difficulties in building computer systems with common sense. The problem was broken down into building reasoners and building knowledge bases. For commonsense reasoners, the idea of using neural nets to learn how to perform symbolic operations (such as those involved in commonsense reasoning) is discussed in the Łukasz Kaiser and Ilya Sutskever article “Neural GPUs Learn Algorithms.” Most of the chapter, however, was about building knowledge bases.

在专家系统时代，构建知识库通常涉及采访专家并让他们提供所需的那种 IF/THEN 规则。使这项任务具有挑战性的是，专家们通常不习惯阐明他们是如何做出决定的。对于预感之类的事情从何而来，内省似乎不是很好的指南。这被称为知识获取瓶颈——专家系统开发过程中的一个主要挑战。有关知识获取的更多信息，请参阅James Brulé 和 Alexander 合着的《知识获取》一书Blount 以及由 Alison Kidd 编辑的专家系统知识获取卷。

In the expert system era, building a knowledge base typically involved interviewing experts and getting them to provide the sort of IF/THEN rules required. What made this task challenging is that experts are not usually in the habit of articulating how they make their decisions. Introspection appears to be a poor guide for where things like hunches come from. This became known as the knowledge acquisition bottleneck—a major challenge in the expert system development process. For more on knowledge acquisition, see the book Knowledge Acquisition by James Brulé and Alexander Blount as well as the edited volume Knowledge Acquisition for Expert Systems by Alison Kidd.

当涉及到常识性知识时，问题就有些不同了，每个人似乎都是专家。第 4 章中讨论的 Cyc 项目是尝试手动构建广泛的常识性知识库的杰出示例。在自动化方面，两个值得注意的实例是 ConceptNet（记录在 Robert Speer 和 Catherine Havasi 的论文“Representing General Relational Knowledge in ConceptNet 5”中）和 NELL（在第 4 章中提到）。Gary Marcus 和 Ernest Davis 对 ConceptNet 和 NELL 的批评在他们的Rebooting AI中，第 151-153 页。Ted Chiang 引用常识的故事出现在他的《呼气》一书中。Stevan Harnad 在“符号接地问题”中讨论了符号接地问题。

The issues are somewhat different when it comes to commonsense knowledge, where everyone is seemingly an expert. The Cyc project, discussed in chapter 4, is the preeminent example of an attempt to build a broad commonsense knowledge base by hand. In terms of automated efforts, two notable instances are ConceptNet (documented in the paper “Representing General Relational Knowledge in ConceptNet 5” by Robert Speer and Catherine Havasi) and NELL (mentioned in chapter 4). The critique of ConceptNet and NELL by Gary Marcus and Ernest Davis is in their Rebooting AI, pages 151–153. The story by Ted Chiang with the quote about common sense appears in his book Exhalation. The symbol grounding problem is discussed by Stevan Harnad in “The Symbol Grounding Problem.”

从文本集合中自动捕获单词含义的一个建议如下：给定文本T 1 , T 2 , … , T N，其中假定N很大，用N的向量表示单词的含义二进制数，如果单词出现在文本T i中，则分量i为 1. （更奇特的向量是可能的。）期望具有相关含义的词将具有相似的向量，并且“你应该通过它所保留的公司来了解一个词”（来自 John Firth 1957 年的文章，“A Synopsis of Linguistic Theory, 1930–1955, ”第 11 页）。这种所谓的单词分布式表示对于根据单词的含义和其他基于相似性的操作来聚合单词似乎非常有用。（例如，参见 Tomá š Mikolov、Wen-tau Yih 和 Geoffrey Zweig 的论文“Linguistic Regularities in Continuous Space Word Representations”。）但它不适合超出常识推理所需的词义之外的操作.

One suggestion for automatically capturing the meaning of words from a collection of texts is the following: given texts T1, T2, … , TN, where N is assumed to be large, represent the meaning of a word by a vector of N binary numbers, where component i is 1 if the word appears in text Ti. (Fancier vectors are possible.) The expectation is that words with related meanings will have similar vectors and “you shall know a word by the company it keeps” (from John Firth’s 1957 article, “A Synopsis of Linguistic Theory, 1930–1955,” page 11). This so-called distributed representation of words appears to be quite useful for aggregating words based on their meanings and other similarity-based operations. (See, for example, the paper “Linguistic Regularities in Continuous Space Word Representations” by Tomáš Mikolov, Wen-tau Yih, and Geoffrey Zweig.) But it does not lend itself to the operations that go beyond word meanings needed for commonsense reasoning.

逐层构建知识库的想法有时称为引导学习，在 Benjamin Kuipers 及其同事的文章“基础表示的引导学习”中有所概述。Judy Herr 的这本精彩的书是她的幼儿课堂创意资源，其中大部分关于 ECE 的材料都是从中汲取的。文中引用的《晚安月亮》是玛格丽特怀斯布朗和克莱门特赫德的幼儿经典。

The idea of constructing a knowledge base layer by layer is sometimes called bootstrap learning, outlined in the article “Bootstrap Learning of Foundational Representations” by Benjamin Kuipers and colleagues. The wonderful book by Judy Herr from which much of the material on ECE was drawn is her Creative Resources for the Early Childhood Classroom. The book Goodnight Moon that is quoted in the text is a toddler’s classic by Margaret Wise Brown and Clement Hurd.

Basic English 项目试图获得一个小而表达充分的英语核心，这将使人们更容易学习，由 Charles Ogden 创建，并在他的书Basic English中介绍。这个项目是网上有很好的记录，并且有许多用基础英语编写的文本示例，包括塞缪尔·胡克 (Samuel Hooke) 的基础英语圣经和奥格登 (Ogden) 的超过两万个单词的通用基础英语词典。有关将有限形式的英语或其他自然语言用于知识表示或其他目的的其他想法，请参阅 Tobias Kuhn 在计算语言学中的“受控自然语言的调查和分类”及其中的参考资料。

The Basic English project was an attempt to get a small but expressively adequate core of English that would be easier for people to learn, created by Charles Ogden, and presented in his book Basic English. This project is well documented online, and there are many examples of texts written in Basic English, including The Bible in Basic English by Samuel Hooke and The General Basic English Dictionary of over twenty thousand words by Ogden. For other ideas on using limited forms of English or other natural languages for knowledge representation or other purposes, see Tobias Kuhn’s “A Survey and Classification of Controlled Natural Languages” in Computational Linguistics and the references therein.

KidzSearch 网站是https://wiki.kidzsearch.com/wiki。请注意，不幸的是，该站点非常不稳定。文中对 gophers 的引述目前隐藏在一堆其他链接中，网站本身现在也被广告和其他干扰所破坏。

The KidzSearch website is https://wiki.kidzsearch.com/wiki. Note that this site is unfortunately quite volatile. The quote on gophers used in the text is currently buried in a flurry of other links, and the website itself is now marred by ads and other distractions.

第 11 章：建立信任

Chapter 11: Building Trust

本章考虑常识，因为它可能适用于未来的自主人工智能技术。最近关于人工智能技术的局限性和风险的文章很多，但几乎所有的文章都集中在所谓的“非自主人工智能”上。

This chapter considers common sense as it might apply to autonomous AI technology of the future. Much has been written of late on the limitations and risks in AI technology, but almost invariably the articles concentrate on what might be called “nonautonomous AI.”

举个例子，Natasha Singer 和 Cade Metz 在 2019 年 12 月的《纽约时报》上发表的一篇文章报道说，各种形式的 AI 面部识别技术错误识别非裔美国人和亚洲人面孔的频率是白人面孔的十到一百倍。这些类型的错误在执法环境中可能是极其有害的。我们完全有理由要求技术不会强化所使用的训练数据中可能存在的偏差。不过，这种系统并不是自主运行的。最终，执法人员（换句话说，人类）必须对这些 AI 工具的局限性承担全部责任，并最终决定如何或是否应该在当前状态下使用它们。

To take one example, an article in the December 2019 New York Times by Natasha Singer and Cade Metz reported that various forms of AI facial-recognition technology misidentified African American and Asian faces ten to a hundred times more frequently than Caucasian faces. These sorts of errors can be extremely harmful in the context of law enforcement. We have every reason to demand technology that does not reinforce biases that might be present in the training data used. Systems of this kind are not operating autonomously, though. In the end, it is the law enforcement personnel (humans, in other words) who must take full responsibility for the limitations of these AI tools, and make the final call on how or if they should be used in their current state.

然而，本章的主题有些不同。它是关于在某个可以想象的未来，人工智能系统可能会被要求为自己做出最后的决定。这些是自主的 AI 系统，有时被称为通用人工智能。（参见Ben Goertzel 和 Cassio Pennachin 编辑的《通用人工智能》一书。）

The topic of this chapter, however, was somewhat different. It was about AI systems in some conceivable future that might be asked to make the final call for themselves. These are autonomous AI systems, sometimes known as artificial general intelligence. (See the volume Artificial General Intelligence edited by Ben Goertzel and Cassio Pennachin.)

就本章的具体参考而言，James Barrat 的Our Final Invention 、Ray Kurzweil 的The Singularity Is Near和默里·沙纳汉 (Murray Shanahan) 的技术奇点。“快速行动，打破陈规”是（或者直到 2014 年）Facebook 的座右铭。（参见 Moshe Vardi 的短文“Move Fast and Break Things”。）早期 Facebook 支持者 Roger McNamee 的引述来自他的Zucked. 有关关键任务软件验证状态的更多信息，请参阅埃德蒙·克拉克、E. 艾伦·爱默生和约瑟夫·西法基斯的文章“模型检查”——基于图灵奖演讲。唐纳德·拉姆斯菲尔德 (Donald Rumsfeld) 关于“未知的未知数”的概念来自美国国防部 2002 年 2 月 12 日的一次简报。关于一般的电车问题，请参阅朱迪思·汤姆森 (Judith Thomson) 的文章“电车问题”，有关批评，请参阅“远离电车问题”和迈向风险管理”，诺亚·古道尔 (Noah Goodall)。丹尼尔·丹尼特 (Daniel Dennett) 的意向立场在他 1989 年出版的《意向立场》( The Intentional Stance)一书中有所介绍。Shanahan 及其同事最近在“人工智能和动物常识”一文中批评了 AI 处理常识的方法过于关注语言及其使用。

In terms of the specific references in this chapter, the notion of superintelligence (and the so-called singularity it gives rise to) is discussed in Our Final Invention by James Barrat, The Singularity Is Near by Ray Kurzweil, and The Technological Singularity by Murray Shanahan. The “move fast and break things” saying is (or was until 2014) the motto of Facebook. (See the short article “Move Fast and Break Things” by Moshe Vardi.) The quote by Roger McNamee, an early Facebook supporter, comes from his Zucked. For more on the state of verification of mission-critical software, see the article “Model Checking”—based on a Turing Award lecture—by Edmund Clarke, E. Allen Emerson, and Joseph Sifakis. The Donald Rumsfeld notion of “unknown unknowns” is from a US Defense Department briefing on February 12, 2002. On trolley problems in general, see the article “The Trolley Problem” by Judith Thomson, and for criticism, see “Away from Trolley Problems and toward Risk Management” by Noah Goodall. Daniel Dennett’s intentional stance is presented in his 1989 book, The Intentional Stance. The critique of the AI approach to common sense as being overly concerned with language and its use was made most recently in “Artificial Intelligence and the Common Sense of Animals” by Shanahan and colleagues.

阿西莫夫的机器人三定律出现在他 1950 年的著作《我，机器人》中。在情节中，法律引用自将于 2058 年出版的机器人手册，内容如下：

Asimov’s three laws of robotics appeared in his 1950 book, I, Robot. Within the plot, the laws are quoted from a robotics handbook to be published in 2058 and are the following:

  1. 1. 机器人不得伤害人类，或因不作为而让人类受到伤害。
  2. 2. 机器人必须服从人类给它的命令，除非这些命令与第一定律相冲突。
  3. 3. 机器人必须保护自己的存在，只要这种保护不违反第一或第二定律。
  1. 1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm.
  2. 2. A robot must obey the orders given it by human beings except where such orders would conflict with the First Law.
  3. 3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws.

（可以说，需要额外的法律来处理整个人类。）当谈到机器运行失常时，Nick Bostrom 涉及回形针的例子出现在他 2014 年的书《超级智能》中。Philip K. Dick 的故事“Autofac”出现在他的Selected Stories中。有关适用于机器学习系统（有时称为可解释 AI）的解释的调查，请参阅 Or Biran 和 Courtenay Cotton 的文章“机器学习中的解释和理由”。Steven Strogatz 关于 AlphaZero 的引述来自他在纽约时报上写的一篇文章，2018 年 12 月 25 日。本章末尾提到的 AlexNet 的对抗性示例由 Christian Szegedy 及其同事于 2014 年在“神经网络的有趣特性”中首次提出，并在 Melanie Mitchell 的人工智能中进一步讨论。

(Arguably, additional laws are needed to deal with humanity as a whole.) When it comes to machines running amok, the Nick Bostrom example involving paper clips appears in his 2014 book, Superintelligence. Philip K. Dick’s story “Autofac” appears in his Selected Stories. For a survey on explanation as it applies to machine learning systems (sometimes called explainable AI), see the article “Explanation and Justification in Machine Learning” by Or Biran and Courtenay Cotton. The quote from Steven Strogatz about AlphaZero was taken from an article he wrote in the New York Times, December 25, 2018. The adversarial examples for AlexNet mentioned at the end of the chapter were first presented by Christian Szegedy and colleagues in 2014 in “Intriguing Properties of Neural Networks,” and further discussed in Melanie Mitchell’s Artificial Intelligence.

顺便说一句，这些对抗性的例子提出了一个重要的方法论问题。人工智能研究的成功通常根据测试用例套件的统计性能来衡量。例如，Keisuke Sakaguchi 及其同事在“WinoGrande”中报告的关于 Winograd 模式的最新成果在一系列全面的测试用例中得到了 90% 的正确答案——这是一项了不起的成就！那么这是否意味着问题得到了本质上的解决，进行或进行一些微调？答案取决于我们从这些测试用例中推断的程度。我们能否预测该系统在大范围内会表现得明智？最后，这是重要的问题。回顾使用 AlexNet 的经历，如果有人以某种不相关的方式调整这些输入，我们是否足够了解该系统以确信它仍然会得到大约 90% 的正确答案？在不了解系统如何工作以及如何做出决策的情况下，我们不应该相信它会做正确的事情，无论它在特定测试用例上的成功率如何。

Incidentally, these adversarial examples raise an important methodological issue. Success in AI research is usually measured in terms of statistical performance on suites of test cases. For instance, a recent effort on Winograd schemas reported by Keisuke Sakaguchi and colleagues in “WinoGrande” got the answers correct 90 percent of the time on a comprehensive series of test cases—an impressive achievement! So does this mean that the problem is essentially solved, give or take some fine tuning? The answer depends on how well we can extrapolate from those test cases. Can we predict that the system will behave sensibly in the large? In the end, this is the question that matters. Recalling the experience with AlexNet, do we understand the system well enough to be confident that it would still get about 90 percent of the answers correct were someone to tweak those inputs in some irrelevant way? Without an understanding of how the system works and how it goes about making its decisions, we should not trust it to be doing the right thing, no matter its rate of success on particular test cases.

最后，知名 AI 研究人员 Stuart Russell最近出版的新书Human Compatible也涉及以负责任的方式设计自主 AI 技术。粗略地说，罗素的立场是，我们必须构建具有目标（或偏好或奖励功能）的 AI 系统，推动它们找到并按照人类的目标采取行动，或者他称之为“最大限度地实现人类偏好”。这对我们来说似乎很正确，但也许还不够。例如，我们可以想象一个人工智能系统，它的世界模型完全错误，但它却以一种被错误地认为是有帮助和有建设性的方式行事，正如罗素所倡导的那样。如果不需要系统是基于知识的，我们可能无法理解它做出的特定选择，就像 AlphaZero 或 AlexNet 的选择一样，即使我们相信它是出于善意行事。换句话说，正如罗素所说，我们应该希望人工智能系统能够按照我们的意愿行事，但我们也需要它们能够展示它们的工作，以便我们能够了解它们哪里出错了，并建议它们如何处理。

Finally, there is the recent book Human Compatible by well-known AI researcher Stuart Russell that also deals with designing autonomous AI technology in a responsible way. Russell’s position, roughly speaking, is that we must build AI systems with goals (or preferences or reward functions) that push them toward finding out and acting on the goals that humans have, or what he calls “maximizing the realization of human preferences.” This seems quite right to us, but perhaps does not go far enough. We can imagine an AI system, for example, whose model of the world is totally wrongheaded, but that acts in what it mistakenly takes to be a helpful and constructive way, exactly as advocated by Russell. If the system is not required to be knowledge based, we may not be able to make sense of the particular choices it makes, just like those of AlphaZero or AlexNet, even if we believe it to be acting in good faith. In other words, we should want AI systems that do what we want, as Russell says, but we also need them to be able to show their work so that we can understand where they get it wrong and advise them what to do about it.

奖励章节：常识的逻辑

Bonus Chapter: The Logic of Common Sense

附加章节是关于常识推理和通常理解的逻辑推理之间有些复杂的关系（如 1982 年 Willard Van Orman Quine 的书《逻辑方法》）。这这两个概念在很大程度上重叠，但在某些情况下，常识承认经典逻辑不认可的结论（如在使用默认值时），而在其他情况下，逻辑认可并非真正属于常识的结论（如在答案中到逻辑谜题）。

The bonus chapter was about the somewhat complex relationship between commonsense reasoning and logical reasoning as it is normally understood (as in the 1982 Willard Van Orman Quine book Methods of Logic, say). The two notions overlap to a large extent, but there are cases where common sense admits conclusions not sanctioned by classical logic (as in the use of defaults), and others where logic sanctions conclusions that are not really part of common sense (as in the answers to logical puzzles).

对于那些对这一领域的研究感兴趣的人，首先要了解经典逻辑和逻辑推理，例如Elliott Mendelson 的Introduction to Mathematical Logic和Herbert Enderton 的A Mathematical Introduction to Logic 。Jaakko Hintikka 的知识与信仰中讨论了与知识的联系和逻辑无所不知的问题。

For those interested in research in this area, the place to start is with an understanding of classical logic and logical reasoning, such as that presented in the books Introduction to Mathematical Logic by Elliott Mendelson and A Mathematical Introduction to Logic by Herbert Enderton. The connection to knowledge and the issue of logical omniscience are discussed in Jaakko Hintikka’s Knowledge and Belief.

本章研究的许多主题都是在我们自己的研究中出现的，并首次出现在 HJL 1986 年的“让计算机成为信徒”中。在那里引入了将世界模型视为有限生动形式的逻辑公式的想法，尽管确切的公式有些不同。这个想法源自 Raymond Reiter 在 1981 年关于用逻辑术语解释数据库的工作（“On Closed World Data Bases”）。其他作者继续展示了如何将更一般形式的信息简化为这种形式。例如，请参阅 David Etherington 及其同事的文章“生动的知识和易处理的推理”，以及Gerd Wagner 的“生动逻辑”一书。对这种方法的批评可以在 1991 年的技术报告Lucid Representations中找到欧内斯特戴维斯。基于 Elliott Sober 的文章“Mental Representations”中的想法，在上面的 HJL 论文中讨论了生动表示和视觉图像之间的联系。涉及 Jack、Anne 和 George 的示例拼图也首先出现在 HJL 论文中，改编自 Robert Moore 1982 年文章“逻辑在知识表示和常识推理中的作用”中的相关插图，后来由心理学家基思·斯坦诺维奇 (Keith Stanovich) 在他的文章“理性和非理性思维”中提出了略有不同的教训。自下而上评估联合查询的想法是关系数据库的支柱，正如Serge Abiteboul 及其同事在教科书数据库基础中看到的那样。

Many of the topics examined in this chapter came up in our own research and were first presented in HJL’s 1986 “Making Believers Out of Computers.” The idea of viewing world models as logical formulas of a limited vivid form was introduced there, although the exact formulation was somewhat different. The idea derived from work by Raymond Reiter in 1981 (“On Closed World Data Bases”) on interpreting databases in logical terms. Other authors went on to show how more general forms of information might be reducible to this form. See, for example, the article “Vivid Knowledge and Tractable Reasoning” by David Etherington and colleagues, and the book Vivid Logic by Gerd Wagner. A critique of this approach can be found in the 1991 technical report Lucid Representations by Ernest Davis. The connection between vivid representations and visual images was discussed in the HJL paper above, based on ideas in the article “Mental Representations” by Elliott Sober. The example puzzle involving Jack, Anne, and George was also first presented in the HJL paper, adapted from a related illustration in the 1982 article “The Role of Logic in Knowledge Representation and Commonsense Reasoning” by Robert Moore, and then picked up later by psychologist Keith Stanovich in his article “Rational and Irrational Thought,” with slightly different lessons to learn. The idea of evaluating a conjunctive query from the bottom up is a mainstay of relational databases, as seen in the textbook Foundations of Databases by Serge Abiteboul and colleagues.

HJL 的文章“Knowledge Representation and Reasoning”中出现了像 L 这样更一般的表示语言的表达能力涉及它可以不说的内容的想法。HJL 和 RJB 在 1987 年发表的文章“知识表示和推理中的表现力和易处理性”中概述了表现力与其对相关推理的要求之间的紧密联系，并探讨了在RJB 和 HJL 的2004 年教科书Knowledge Representation and Reasoning的第 16 章中。

The idea that the expressiveness of a more general representation language like L involves what it can leave unsaid appears in the article “Knowledge Representation and Reasoning” by HJL. The strong connection between expressiveness and the demands it then places on the associated reasoning is outlined in the 1987 article “Expressiveness and Tractability in Knowledge Representation and Reasoning” by HJL and RJB, and explored in chapter 16 of the 2004 textbook, Knowledge Representation and Reasoning, by RJB and HJL.

已经做出了许多努力来研究表现力和易处理性之间的联系。这项工作本质上有点技术性，但基本思想是研究对像世界模型这样的表示进行什么样的扩展仍然可以有效地回答某些问题。参见 HJL 1998 年的文章“A Completeness Result for Reasoning with Incomplete First-Order Knowledge Bases”以及 2011 年的文章“Efficient Reasoning in Proper Knowledge Bases with Unknown Individuals”，例如 Giuseppe De Giacomo、Yves Lespérance 和 HJL .

A number of efforts have been made to look at the connection between expressiveness and tractability. The work is somewhat technical in nature, but the basic idea is to investigate what sorts of extensions to representations like world models would still allow certain questions to be answered efficiently. See the 1998 article “A Completeness Result for Reasoning with Incomplete First-Order Knowledge Bases” by HJL as well as the 2011 article “Efficient Reasoning in Proper Knowledge Bases with Unknown Individuals” by Giuseppe De Giacomo, Yves Lespérance, and HJL, for example.

一个特别棘手的案例涉及在世界模型中使用析取。回到第 7 章，这将允许我们在世界模型中将苏的出生地表示为菲尼克斯或图森。有趣的是，没有人知道此步棋是否天生就更难推理。该问题等同于著名的P=NP问题，该问题由斯蒂芬·库克 (Stephen Cook) 在 1971 年开创性的文章“定理证明程序的复杂性”中首次提出。尽管从那时起成千上万的计算机科学家和数学家做出了最大的努力，但没有人知道答案。因为它与许多其他计算问题有关，所以这个问题被认为是计算机科学中最重要的未解决问题。（请参阅 Lance Fortnow 的文章“P 与 NP 问题的现状”。）使事情更加复杂的是，有一些称为SAT 求解器的计算机程序在实践中即使在巨大的输入下也能很好地工作，尽管它们偶尔会出错。（请参阅 Carla Gomes 及其公司撰写的“可满足性求解器”一文。）

One especially tricky case involves the use of disjunctions in a world model. Going back to chapter 7, this would allow us to represent the birthplace of Sue as Phoenix or Tucson in a world model, for instance. Interestingly, nobody knows whether this move must inherently be more difficult for reasoning. The question is equivalent to the famous P=NP question, first posed by Stephen Cook in his groundbreaking 1971 article, “The Complexity of Theorem-Proving Procedures.” Despite the best efforts of thousands of computer scientists and mathematicians since then, nobody knows the answer. Because of its connection to many other computational problems, this question is considered to be the most important open problem in computer science. (See the article “The Status of the P versus NP Problem” by Lance Fortnow.) To further complicate matters, there are computer programs called SAT solvers that do appear to work quite well in practice even on enormous inputs, although they stumble occasionally. (See the “Satisfiability Solvers” article by Carla Gomes and company.)

心理学家菲利普·约翰逊-莱尔德 (Philip Johnson-Laird) 关于心智模型的研究始于他 1983 年出版的《心智模型》一书。文本中涉及狗的谜题示例改编自第 67 页的一个谜题（银行家被重铸为后院的狗，运动员被重铸为吉姆的狗，议员被重铸为小狗）。更多关于心智模型的最新想法可以在 Johnson-Laird 于 2010 年发表的文章“心智模型和人类推理”以及 Sangeet Khemlani 及其同事于 2018 年发表的“事实和可能性”一文中找到。对于历史基础，Johnson-Laird 引用了来自Charles Sanders Peirce 的作品，收录于 1931 年出版的Collected Papers of Charles Sanders Peirce中。Johnson-Laird 还称赞哲学家 Kenneth Craik 在 1943 年的《解释的本质》中提出“这种思维是对世界内部表征的操纵。”

The work by psychologist Philip Johnson-Laird on mental models begins with his 1983 book, Mental Models. The example puzzle in the text involving dogs is adapted from one on page 67 (with bankers recast as dogs in the backyard, athletes as Jim’s dogs, and councillors as small dogs).
