More recent thoughts on mental models can be found in the article “Mental Models and Human Reasoning” by Johnson-Laird in 2010, and “Facts and Possibilities” by Sangeet Khemlani and colleagues in 2018. For historical grounding, Johnson-Laird cites inspiration from the work of Charles Sanders Peirce, gathered in the 1931 volume Collected Papers of Charles Sanders Peirce. Johnson-Laird also credits philosopher Kenneth Craik for proposing in the 1943 The Nature of Explanation “that thinking is the manipulation of internal representations of the world.”

正如本章末尾所建议的，另一种确保常识性推理不过分苛刻的方法是在知识库中允许不受限制的（非生动的）公式，但限制可以使用它们进行的推理种类。由此产生的信念概念在逻辑蕴涵下将不再封闭，问题是找出什么“微积分种类”应该取代它。HJL 于 1984 年发表的文章“A Logic of Implicit and Explicit Belief”就是这方面工作的一个早期例子；在 Lakemeyer 和 HJL 于 2020 年发表的文章“基于可能世界的有限信念的一阶逻辑”中可以找到最近的一项提议，但现在允许使用量词。如前所述，知识表示和推理领域的许多研究都可以理解为在这个可能性空间中寻找额外的选择。请参阅 HJL 的文章“知识表示和推理”。

As suggested at the end of the chapter, another way to ensure that commonsense reasoning is not overly demanding is to allow unrestricted (nonvivid) formulas in the knowledge base, but to limit the sorts of reasoning that can be done with them. The resulting notion of belief would no longer be closed under logical entailment, and the problem is to find out what “species of calculus” should replace it. An early example of work on this is in the article “A Logic of Implicit and Explicit Belief” by HJL from 1984; a recent proposal along the same lines, but now allowing for quantifiers, can be found in the 2020 article “A First-Order Logic of Limited Belief Based on Possible Worlds” by Lakemeyer and HJL. As noted, much of the research in the area of knowledge representation and reasoning can be understood as looking for additional alternatives in this space of possibilities. See the article “Knowledge Representation and Reasoning” by HJL.

参考书目

Brachman, Ronald J. 和 Hector J. Levesque 编着。知识表示中的读物。加利福尼亚州洛斯阿尔托斯：Morgan Kaufmann Publishers, Inc.，1985 年。

布鲁克斯，罗德尼 A。“没有代表的情报”。人工智能47，没有。1–3 (1991): 139–159。

Brooks, Rodney A. “Intelligence without Representation.” Artificial Intelligence 47, no. 1–3 (1991): 139–159.

布朗、玛格丽特·怀斯和克莱门特·赫德。晚安月亮。纽约：学术图书服务，1947 年。

洛特菲扎德，264–265 年

关于作者

About the Authors

Ron Brachman 的职业生涯主要是在工业界担任研究科学家和研究负责人。在 AT&T 贝尔实验室/AT&T 实验室工作的 17 年里，他建立了世界一流的人工智能和机器学习团队，最终成为副总裁。他后来是雅虎实验室的负责人，还担任过雅虎的首席科学家。他曾担任 DARPA 信息处理技术办公室主任多年，在此期间他创建了最终导致 Siri 开发的程序。Brachman 目前担任纽约市康奈尔理工学院 Jacobs Technion-Cornell 研究所所长，同时也是康奈尔大学计算机科学教授。他是计算机协会会员，电气和电子工程师协会会员，

Ron Brachman’s career has been spent mostly in industry as a research scientist and research leader. In his seventeen years at AT&T Bell Labs/AT&T Labs, he built a world-class AI and machine learning team, eventually becoming a vice president. He was later the head of Yahoo Labs and also served as Yahoo’s chief scientist. He spent several years as the director of the Information Processing Technology Office at DARPA, during which time he created the program that eventually led to the development of Siri. Brachman currently works as the director of the Jacobs Technion-Cornell Institute at Cornell Tech in New York City, and is a professor of computer science at Cornell University. He is a fellow of the Association for Computing Machinery, Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, and American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS).

Hector Levesque 的大部分职业生涯都在多伦多大学计算机科学系度过，现在他是那里的名誉教授。他是许多获奖 AI 研究论文和多本书的作者或合著者，包括一本本科教科书，Thinking as Computation：A First Course（2012 年），以及一本非专业人士的书，常识，图灵测试和探索真正的人工智能(2017)。Levesque 是加拿大皇家学会和美国科学促进会的会员。

Hector Levesque spent most of his career in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Toronto, where he is now a professor emeritus. He is the author or coauthor of a number of prizewinning AI research papers and several books, including an undergraduate textbook, Thinking as Computation: A First Course (2012), and a book for nonspecialists, Common Sense, the Turing Test, and the Quest for Real AI (2017). Levesque is a fellow of the Royal Society of Canada and AAAS.

Brachman 和 Levesque 是两个最负盛名的 AI 研究组织的杰出成员，即拥有四千多名成员的 AI 促进协会 (AAAI) 和每两年举办一次 AI 会议的 AI 国际联合会议 (IJCAI)自 1969 年以来。Brachman 一直担任 AAAI 主席和 IJCAI 秘书兼财务主管。Levesque 曾在 AAAI 执行委员会任职，并担任 IJCAI 董事会主席。他们都是创始AAAI 研究员，并在年度 AAAI 会议上获得最佳论文奖。Levesque 是唯一一位在其学术生涯开始时获得 IJCAI 计算机和思想奖，并在结束时获得 IJCAI 卓越研究奖的研究人员。

Brachman and Levesque are prominent members of the two most prestigious AI research organizations, the Association for the Advancement of AI (AAAI), which has over four thousand members, and International Joint Conferences on AI (IJCAI), which has held biennial conferences on AI since 1969. Brachman has served as president of the AAAI and secretary-treasurer of the IJCAI. Levesque has served on the executive council of AAAI and as president of the board of trustees of the IJCAI. They are both founding fellows of the AAAI and have won best paper awards at the annual AAAI conferences. Levesque is the only researcher to have won both the IJCAI Computers and Thought award at the start of his academic career, and the IJCAI Research Excellence award at the end.

Brachman 和 Levesque 一起在各种各样的项目上进行了合作，并且自 1970 年代以来一直是知识表示和推理领域的领头羊，这是本书主题的核心 AI 子领域。他们与 Raymond Reiter 一起发起了该领域的第一个大型国际会议，该会议至今已持续了三十年，他们还共同撰写了广受欢迎的研究生教科书《知识表示与推理》 (2004)。

Together, Brachman and Levesque have collaborated on a wide variety of projects, and have been lead players since the 1970s in knowledge representation and reasoning, the subarea of AI that is central to the topic of this book. With Raymond Reiter, they launched the first major international conference in this area, which has continued now for thirty years, and together they wrote the popular graduate textbook Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (2004).
